project.name: dvdstoreall
project.shortDescription: Seam DVD Store Example - EAR
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of Seam with jBPM pageflow and business process management. It includes the dvdstore,dvdstore-ear and dvdstore-ejb projects.

project.name: booking
project.shortDescription: Seam Booking Example - EAR
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of Seam in a Java EE 5 environment. Transaction and persistence context management is handled by the EJB container. This example can also run in Tomcat with JBoss Embedded. It includes the booking, booking-ear and booking-ejb projects.

project.name: booking2
project.shortDescription: Seam Booking Example - EAR mavenized
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of Seam in a Java EE 5 environment. Transaction and persistence context management is handled by the EJB container. It includes the booking, booking-ear, booking-ejb and booking-parent projects. Requires m2eclipse >= 0.9.7.20081001-2217

project.name: booking3
project.shortDescription: Seam Booking Example - EAR mavenized - Seam 2.1.1.GA
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of Seam in a Java EE 5 environment. Transaction and persistence context management is handled by the EJB container. It includes the booking, booking-ear, booking-ejb and booking-parent projects. Requires m2eclipse >= 0.9.7.20081001-2217

project.name: jboss-seam-jpa
project.shortDescription: Seam Booking Example - WAR Standalone
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of Seam in a Java EE 5 environment. Transaction and persistence context management is handled by the EJB container. This example can also run in Tomcat with JBoss Embedded.

project.name: testjavaportlet
project.shortDescription: JBoss Java Portlet Example
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of JBoss Java Portlet. It runs on JBoss Portal 2.7.0.

project.name: testjsfportlet
project.shortDescription: JBoss JSF Portlet Example
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of JBoss JSF Portlet. It runs on JBoss Portal 2.7.0.

project.name: testseamportlet
project.shortDescription: JBoss Seam Portlet Example
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of JBoss Seam Portlet. It runs on JBoss Portal 2.7.0.

project.name: helloworld
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB HelloWorld Example - ESB
project.description: This example is to prove that the ESB is is properly configured and happy. As well as to demonstrate the needed minimal files to make a basic ESB component execute.

project.name: helloworld_testclient
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB HelloWorld Example - Client
project.description: This example is to demonstrate how to invoke the deployed HelloWorld ESB. It requires the helloworld project.

project.name: helloworld_action
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB HelloWorld Action Example - ESB
project.description: This sample is to demonstrate the use of multiple action invocations from a single configuration. You can use a single Action class and make multiple method calls or use multiple Action classes.

project.name: helloworld_action_client
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB HelloWorld Action Example - Client
project.description: This sample is to test the deployed helloworld_action ESB. It requires the helloworld_action project

project.name: helloworld_file_action
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB HelloWorld File Action Example - ESB
project.description: This is a basic example of using the File gateway feature of the JBoss ESB. Files that are found in a particular directory with a particular extension are sent to a JMS queue with actions for processing. Before deploy the project, please change some properties according to the readme.txt file.

project.name: helloworld_file_action_client
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB HelloWorld File Action Example - Client
project.description: This sample is to test the deployed helloworld_file_action ESB. It requires the helloworld_file_action project.

project.name: webservice_consumer1
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Web Service consumer1 Example
project.description: This example demonstrates how to consume a 181 Web Service in an ESB action. This ESB will make a webservice request that requires a single "toWhom" string parameter. The webservice will return a greeting response. The ESB simply dislays the response on the console.

project.name: webservice_consumer1_client
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Web Service consumer1 Example - Client
project.description: This sample is to test the deployed a comsumer web service.It requires the webservice_consumer1 project.

project.name: webservice_producer
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Web Service producer Example
project.description: This sample demonstrates how to deploy a JSR181 Webservice endpoint on JBossESB using the SOAPProcessor action.

project.name: webservice_producer_client
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Web Service producer Example - Client
project.description: This sample is to test the deployed a web service endpoint.It requires the webservice_producer project.

project.name: transform_CSV2XML
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks CSV->XML Example
project.description: This sample demonstrates how to transform a comma separated value (CSV) file to an xml. The tranformation is done by configuring Smooks and performing two transformation, one transformation from CSV to an intermediate xml format, and a second transformation from the intermediate xml format to the target xml.

project.name: transform_CSV2XML_client
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks CSV->XML Example - Client
project.description: This sample is to test the JBoss ESB smooks CSV->XML transformation.It requires the transform_CSV2XML project.

project.name: transform_XML2POJO
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks XML->POJO Example
project.description: The purpose of the simple_transformation sample is to illustrate the use of Smooks performing a simple transformation by converting a XML file into Java POJOs.

project.name: transform_XML2POJO_client
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks XML->POJO Example - Client
project.description: This sample is to test the JBoss ESB smooks XML->POJO transformation.It requires the transform_XML2POJO project.

project.name: transform_XML2XML_date_manipulation
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks XML->XML date-manipulation Example
project.description:
This is another simple sample of how to manually define and apply a Message Transformation within JBoss ESB.
This sample is an extension of the "transformation_XML2XML_simple" Quickstart, demonstrating how JBoss ESB Transformations can simplify your XSLT transformations by combining the power of XSLT with Java. In this Quickstart, we use Java to perform the ugly string manipulation on the SampleOrder date field (see OrderDate.java) and use XSLT for what it's good at i.e. Templating. Again, the transformed SampleOrder.xml message is just printed to the Java console (message before and after).

project.name: transform_XML2XML_date_manipulation_client
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks XML->XML date-manipulation Example - Client
project.description: This sample is to test the JBoss ESB XML->XML date-manipulation transformation.It requires the transform_XML2XML_date_manipulation project.

project.name: transform_XML2XML_simple
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks XML->XML Example
project.description: This is a very basic sample of how to manually define and apply a Message Transformation within JBoss ESB. It applies a very simple XSLT to a SampleOrder.xml message and prints the before and after XML to the console.

project.name: transform_XML2XML_simple_client
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks XML->XML Example - Client
project.description: This sample is to test the JBoss ESB XML->XML transformation.It requires the transform_XML2XML_simple project.

project.name: RichFaces 3.2.2.SP1 Demo Application for JBoss AS 4.2.X
project.shortDescription: RichFaces 3.2.2.SP1 Demo Application - WAR
project.description: This example contains RichFaces 3.2.2.SP1 Demo Application

project.name: simple
project.shortDescription: RESTEasy Simple Example
project.description: This project is a simple example showing usage of @Path, @GET, PUT, POST, and @PathParam. It uses pure streaming output and includes the 'simple' project. Requires m2eclipse >= 0.9.7.20081001-2217. You can install it using the following update site: http://m2eclipse.sonatype.org/update-dev/
